00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 
00003 Author: Julie Betlach
00004 
00005 Adapted from code written by: Terry Caton, tcaton(a)hotmail.com
00006 Project Webpage: http://cajun-jsonapi.sourceforge.net/
00007 
00008 Original code parsed files in json format.
00009 Code now parses files in PDI format for a project for Washington University,
00010 course CSE 533S: Pattern Oriented Software Design and Development, Summer 2009.
00011 
00012 classes: QuickInterpreter
00013          QuickBuilder
00014 
00015 The classes in this file provide an alternative interface for very quickly
00016 extracting or  compiling data into a JSON document structure. They are useful
00017 when the structure of a document is rigid and well-known, which is often the
00018 case.
00019

00024 #include "elements.h"

00027 namespace PDI
00028 {
00029 
00053 class QuickInterpreter
00054 {
00055 public:
00056    QuickInterpreter(const Element& element) :
00057       m_Element(element) {}
00058 
00059    QuickInterpreter operator[] (const std::string& key) const {
00060       const Array& obj = As<Array>();
00061       return obj[key];
00062    }
00063 
00064    operator const Element& () const { return m_Element; }
00065 
00066    template <typename ElementTypeT>
00067    const ElementTypeT& As() const { return PDI_cast<const ElementTypeT&>(m_Element); }
00068 
00069 private:
00070    const Element& m_Element;
00071 };
00072 
00073 
00074 class QuickBuilder
00075 {
00076 public:
00077    QuickBuilder(Element& element) :
00078       m_Element(element) {}
00079 
00080    QuickBuilder operator[] (const std::string& key) {
00081       Array& obj = Convert<Array>();
00082       return obj[key];
00083    }
00084 
00085    QuickBuilder& operator = (const Element& element) {
00086       m_Element = element;
00087       return *this;
00088    }
00089 
00090    operator Element& () { return m_Element; }
00091 
00092    template <typename ElementTypeT>
00093    ElementTypeT& As() { return PDI_cast<ElementTypeT&>(m_Element); }
00094 
00095    template <typename ElementTypeT>
00096    ElementTypeT& Convert() {
00097       // we want an ElementTypeT. make it one if it's not.
00098       try {
00099          return As<ElementTypeT>();
00100       }
00101       catch (Exception&) {
00102          m_Element = ElementTypeT();
00103          return As<ElementTypeT>();
00104       }
00105    }
00106 
00107 private:
00108    Element& m_Element;
00109 };
